Messages.Author: Darshit Paresh Suratwala
Messages.Content: Dear Students, I hope you are doing well. A gentle reminder, that it would be great if you could fill out the survey form. The link is below:   https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=VT7C2. Regards, Darshit Suratwala

Messages.Author: Jean-Pierre Seifert
Messages.Content: Dear Mr./Ms. Prof. Dr. Seifert,  with this e-mail you will receive the link as well as the associated QR-code for a survey for your course "Quantum Computing (Vorlesung/ Übung)": https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=VT7C2.  The survey should take place from 06/17 - 06/28/2024. The survey period for individual courses can be extended on request. Please forward the link to other people in your group if necessary.  Please pass the link on to the students in the course and give them about 5 - 10 minutes to complete it. You are also welcome to use the QR-code at the end of this email.   Further information on evaluation at Faculty IV and tips for increasing the response rate can be found here.  You will receive the results of the survey after the end of the survey period, so you can still have a feedback meeting within the semester.

Messages.Author: Darshit Paresh Suratwala
Messages.Content: Hello Students, Today's exercise session is from 14:00 to 16:00 in room number PC 203. Regards, Darshit

Messages.Author: Darshit Paresh Suratwala
Messages.Content: Hello Students,  The presentation in the pdf format has been attached below. Please have a look. Note: Many slides have been added later for better understanding and it will get updated as and when required. Regards, Darshit Suratwala

Messages.Author: Darshit Paresh Suratwala
Messages.Content: Hello Students,  The pdf file is attached below for your first tutorial which includes an explanation of the Deutsch-Jozsa Algorithm and how to install Qiskit.  Note: Complete the Hello World example by taking a screenshot of your work and creating a PDF by next week. I will tell you later how to upload it.  Note: To avoid uploading different files, I will edit the same attachment as we progress further in the tutorials.  Regards, Darshit

Messages.Author: Darshit Paresh Suratwala
Messages.Content: Hello, There will be an exercise session on 17th June, Monday at 14:00 to 16:00, room number: PC 203

Messages.Author: Darshit Paresh Suratwala
Messages.Content: Dear Students, Sorry for the inconvenience but there will be no lecture/session today due to unforeseen reasons. So see you all next week for the lecture and exercise session. Best Regards, Darshit

Messages.Author: Jean-Pierre Seifert
Messages.Content: Dear students, sorry about the chaos today and me not showing up. Due to the shutdown of the TEL building (water flood all over from broken waterpipe) we have no offices and were told to do home office. As I want to give the course not via zoom, I thought that one of my team announced that the course will regularly start next week in person. So, see you all next week. Best,    jps

Messages.Author: Peter Kopylov
Messages.Content: I discovered a really good YouTube channel explaining many things covered in the lecture in a clear and concise way, I wanted to share it. Check it out, it might be helpful!  https://www.youtube.com/@quantum-soar/featured
